intro: Packera moranii, commonly known as Moran's paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and open woodlands, preferring cool, temperate climates. Its showy, yellowish-orange flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Packera moranii is notable for its delicate, hairy leaves and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
